pullrequest.title: Workaround for arm64 qemu problem with man-db

content.raw:
Thanks for the the FYI. It's interesting that this is so repeatable.

The ROS buildfarm had seen periodic hangs with certain CMake commands (https://github.com/ros-infrastructure/ros_buildfarm/issues/214) before and after the jump to Docker 17.05 with the xenial migration.
But since https://github.com/osrf/multiarch-docker-image-generation/pull/14 was deployed build.ros.org has been running qemu images fine with few, if-any hangs. I sampled a few jobs and although several installed man-db, none had `Processing triggers for man-db` in their logs

What version of Docker is on the hosts that were failing?
content.html:
Thanks for the the FYI. It's interesting that this is so repeatable.

The ROS buildfarm had seen periodic hangs with certain CMake commands (https://github.com/ros-infrastructure/ros_buildfarm/issues/214) before and after the jump to Docker 17.05 with the xenial migration. But since https://github.com/osrf/multiarch-docker-image-generation/pull/14 was deployed build.ros.org has been running qemu images fine with few, if-any hangs. I sampled a few jobs and although several installed man-db, none had Processing triggers for man-db in their logs

What version of Docker is on the hosts that were failing?
